sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines

div.p: Meisl [Meisel], restaurant on the corner of Reisnerstraße and Heumarkt, near the Stadtpark entrance, in Vienna's third district (Landstraße), thus a few minute's walk from Schenker's apartment, which the Schenker's favored over the Lembacher Inn in 1919 (OJ 8/3, [67]).

Schenker met there with Wilhelm Furtwängler and Moriz Violin on the evening of April 24, 1920 (OJ 3/1, pp. 2229-2230), in what was a lengthy and times testy discussion of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony, and Schenker's use of polemic--a meeting that continued on the street (where Schenker declared he felt "the necessity to strike my opponents dead"), and in the Vindobona coffee-house, where they discussed Beethoven's autograph manuscripts.
